DOC.brief_summary: This randomize clinical trial ( RCT ) determine effectiveness vitamin D3 supplementation depressive symptom , self-management , blood pressure approximately 180 adult woman type 2 diabetes significant depressive symptom . Consenting adult woman eligible participate randomly assign either weekly dose 50,000 international unit vitamin D3 supplementation match weekly active comparator 5,000 international unit vitamin D3 six month . Participants complete approximately four in-person study visit several telephone visit throughout six month trial period , researcher assess depressive symptom , diabetes self-management , systolic blood pressure . Aim 1 : To determine effect vitamin D supplementation depressive symptom ( primary outcome ) , self-management ( secondary outcome ) , systolic blood pressure ( exploratory outcome ) compare placebo . Hypothesis : Women receive vitamin D supplementation report few depressive symptom , increase diabetes self- management mediate depression improvement , low systolic blood pressure compare take placebo three six month follow-up . Aim 2 : To explore mechanistic effect vitamin D supplementation inflammatory biomarkers association depression . Hypothesis : Women receive vitamin D supplementation decrease inflammatory biomarkers associate few depressive symptom compare take placebo three six month follow-up
